reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: We just returned from 10 days spent on Oahu. This is my 3rd trip and thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor, everything went perfectly. We stayed at the Outigger Luana for the first 4 days.

reviews.title: Great stay on New Year's Eve
reviews.text: The Outrigger Luana is 10 mintues from the beach but unlike most hotels, what separates it from the water is a beautiful park. It was always a delightful walk to the beach with a myriad of plants to enjoy.

reviews.title: Very Enjoyable
reviews.text: Our room was just as depected on their website photos. We were on the 11th floor and had a gorgeous view of the ocean straight across the parkway -- no hotels in the way and no view the size of a sliver. The rooms were clean and so quiet. The bed, tables, and closet area were all in beautiful wood with a pineapple and bamboo motiff throughout.

reviews.title: Very satisfied
reviews.text: The hotel employees bent over backwards to help us out and the bus stop was across the street. The kitchette was more than I had hoped for. It had place settings for 4, and all the cooking utinsels and bowls that we needed.

reviews.title: Excellent Choice
reviews.text: There were plenty of resturants within walking distance for those times that we ate out. Our favorite was The Shorebird. We dined while watching the sunset and listening to live entertainment. The food was wonderful.

We stayed here in early December around the time of the Honolulu marathon and it was defintely a great choice. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a view over the park. This is a condo hotel, recently renovated with new furniture, small kitchenettes in some rooms, granite counter tops and a small balcony. Its about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach in front of the Hilton, a 15 min walk to the main mall, close to many restaurants, convenience stores, and a grocery store about a ten minute walk away.
reviews.title: Great choice for budget concious traveller

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Hawaii- had a wonderful time, as always! This was our 12th trip. We've stayed in several hotels and condos in Oahu over the years and found the Luana Waikiki to be a good place to stay. The rooms are updated very nicely with tile floors and granite counter tops. The Hawaiian lamps were cute too. There is a nice park outside and the beach is a 10-15 minute walk away- take a right outside the hotel, walk across park area, right on Saratoga road, and you can walk through Outrigger Reef on Beach Hotel or use the Beach Walk. They have a nice, clean pool area and Fitness Center also. There is also a Grill area available by the pool. I'd stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Gas Station View
reviews.text: Outrigger Luana Waikiki

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 7 days in December. The hotel was very clean and the beds very comfortable but, the view was horrible. We had a room on the 3rd. floor and our balcony overlooked the roof of a gas station, a very busy, noisy gas station. Our family had 3 different rooms, ours was the most expensive and had the worst view and the smallest space. I mentioned this to the front desk and they were not helpful and did not offer to change or upgrade our room. We had to ask for the proper number of towel sets daily even though we spoke with the front desk about that also. While I liked many things about this hotel I would have to think about staying here again. I definitly would want to preview the room first.
reviews.title: Great Waikiki Hotel

reviews.text: Very pleased with this hotel. Have stayed in many others on Waikiki often with problems, especially too much cig. smoke. But not here - its a non-smoking hotel. Also, a plus is the fact that the rooms do not have carpet but a type of ceramic tile. Rooms were clean and quiet and ours had a partial view of the ocean.
reviews.title: Good value, dependable hotel
Great View
reviews.text: We just returned from Honolulu (March 9-12) and were very pleased with the Outrigger Luana Waikiki. We had reserved a City/Park view but were upgraded to a partial ocean view without asking. From other reviews I've read some POVs are a sliver between buildings if you lean out over your balcony. We could see ours when sitting inside on the pullout couch. And it was spectacular! There are no buildings near the hotel to block your view just a wonderful grassy park. I had been a little leary that since it was right on the main street toward Waikiki it might have alot of street noise but I didn't notice and I usually am sensitive to that. Our room (911)was right above those fans from the restaurant next door but not noticeable with the door closed and we didn't have a problem talking to each other when sitting on the balcony. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had a nice size counter and narrow but adequate tub/shower. The blackout curtains were especially welcome. A microwave would have been a nice bonus but other rooms do have those. The refrigerator was on the large size for an undercounter one and the sink and counter came in handy. It had alot of cabinets and a full set of knives and enough plates, etc. which we didn't use but would be nice if you were staying for a while. The room felt good when you entered it. I would absolutely stay here again!

The Outrigger Luana is probably one of the best values in the Waikiki area. The rooms are modern & comfortable, the staff is friendly, and the location is ideal for those who will visit other areas of Oahu by car.
reviews.title: For the price...you can't beat it
We enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: The pool is small and atypical. The fitness center is also small but has the basics. The lobby is comfortable and has free wireless Internet access.

reviews.title: Only certain rooms are good
reviews.text: For the money (about $135 per night) you can't get comparable accomodations. I've spent far more on inferior hotels in Oahu (i.e. The Park Shore). Save your money for other activities in Hawaii and stay here...it's a steal!
We're going back in April to see U2 and we've already booked at the Outrigger Luana once again.
reviews.title: I will go back
Great Deal
reviews.text: Just stayed 5 nights at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki and was extremely pleased. We took the Waikiki Shuttle from the airport and, since this hotel/condo is at the entrance to Waikiki, we were one of the first stops.

reviews.title: Clean and convenient!
reviews.text: The lobby was quaint and elegant with friendly staff. The first room we were given on the 2nd floor only had one bed so we requested to move to a higher floor with two beds and were easily accommodated with a room (without kitchen) on the 7th floor. We had a view of Ft. DeRussy Park and had a partial view of the Ocean in the distance. The room exceeded my expectations, as it was elegantly designed with marble flooring and very comfortable beds. The hotel/condo was extremely quiet, although we were facing Kalakaua Ave (a very busy street,) so sitting on the lanai was a little noisy. We were walking distance from the beach (Ft. DeRussy) and got a lot of exercise walking to and from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki beach. If you are looking for something a little away from the "business," then this is the place. Elegant shopping is across the street and Da Kine donuts is not too far away (they have the best buttermilk bars). I would definitely stay here again. This was a great deal through Expedia.

reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE
reviews.text: I stayed here along with a bunch of my girlfriends for my bachelorette party and was very pleased with the service and overall experience at this hotel. We had a one bedroom suite w/ a full kitchen which was great! There are no restaurants on site, but many nearby. You will not be dissapointed if you stay here!

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Stayed October 7 through 14th. Had a one bedroon ocean view (through the park) with Kitchen. All furnishings were in excellent order. The general standard of cleanliness throughout the facility was remarkable. All in all for what we paid it was an excellent choice.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for five nights and were so happy with our choice. The hotel has just been aquired by the outrigger and was previously a time share. The rooms are exactly how they look on the website, which are very nice. The rooms are comfortable with a couch area as well as a table and chairs eating area. As stated by other guest,they gave us a free upgrade with a better view, because when we checked in early the cheaper room we had booked wasn't available yet. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the hotel gives you a few postcards that they will apply postage and mail for you. Here a few reasons why we enjoyed this hotel:

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki in September. The room was great and it had a nice view of the area. The staff was very helpful and eager to please. This hotel is close to shopping and a short stroll from the beach. The room was quiet with a very comfortable bed. The in-room kitchenette makes it easy to not have to eat out for every meal. The quality, price and location all add up to an excellent value. If you don't need to stay right on the beach, this is the place to be.

reviews.title: Loved the Luana
reviews.text: We stayed here in July and loved it. Its really close to everything. We had beautiful views of everything from our room. Very very clean, nicely decorated, comfortable beds and friendly staff. Having a kitchenette in our room helped save money and we found it to be very convienient. Parking was ok...it cost $12/day and we found a spot every day. Driving around in the area was tough though, as there are many one way streets. Overall, would most definitely stay there again in a heartbeat!

reviews.title: Luana No Ka Oi!
reviews.text: We were very pleased with Outrigger Luana Waikiki with respect to location, size of rooms, amenities and price. Located on Kalakaua, the main shopping street, it is close to all the great Waikiki shops and restaurants, but is not right in the heart of the craziness. Beautiful Ala Moana beach is a ten-minute walk away, through Fort DeRussy’s park-like grounds. An ABC Store and TGIFriday’s are across the street, as is a great coffee stand.

reviews.title: Loved the Luana!
reviews.text: The kitchenette in our studio was well-stocked with cooking and serving utensils, a microwave and small refrigerator. Everything was well-maintained and clean. The pool is private and the fitness room is well-equipped. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Wonderful, small, new and clean hotel
reviews.text: Don't miss breakfast at Hotel Halekulani, a ten-minute walk away, or a very special dinner at their Orchids Restaurant. We enjoyed memorable dinners at the Hula Grill and Chuck's Steakhouse, where we avoided the pandemonium at Duke's downstairs and got fabulous views of the beach and Diamond Head! Our dinner at Chai's Island Bistro where we were fortunate enough to hear the Brothers Cazimero perform (Wednesday nights) was also unforgettable.

reserved a studio w/city/park view months ahead; arrived jan. 10th (during the Sony Classic Golf tourney)but had ant problems. nice staff attempted to move me to another room--still ants cruising along the floor. finally, relocated to another of their properties, Ohana West (no ants), where i had to take a smoking room, above the pool. i received the same Entertainment discount but now had to take the bus to my conference hotel, the Illikai. Throughout, the staff were very nice and accomodating. These were the very tiny ants, and i am sure they would have left me alone but the very idea of their activity would have sent me into fussy mode (go and buy a can of pesticide and spray around the clock). i believe that once they get into the walls it is difficult to dislodge them.
reviews.title: nice staff, but ant problems
